item.title: Machine Learning
item.description:
Yuhao's Blog https://yuhaolu.github.io/posts/cs/ml_stanford/ -

Machine Learning

Ref: https://www.coursera.org/learn/machine-learning

Mimic human learning process of generating output based on specified inputs, like a turning machine

Supervised Machine Learning

Regression and Classification

  • Linear regression
  • logistic regression
  • gradient descent

Neural Network

prob: high training error - high bias sol: consider more features -> use larger neural network

prob: high correlation error - high variance sol: cut weights of some features -> use more data

Understanding comes from talent & intelligence, Deduction comes from learning & experience

Iterative Loop of ML development

  1. Choose architecture (model, data etc)
  2. Train model
  3. Diagnostics(bias, variance, error analysis)

AI = Code + Data

What if you don’t have data?

  1. Hand labeling critical data bins
  2. Synthesis data by adding variations of existing datasets (ex. rotate text fonts)

Transfer Learning: Supervised pre-training + fine tuning

  • Only train output layers parameters
  • train all parameters

Decision tree

recursively picking the tree split that reduce enthropy the best

Random Forest algorithm: Use multiple distinctive decision trees XGBoost Tree: train the tree on samples that doesn’t preform well in previous iterations

Unsupervised Learning

  • Clustering
    • K-means
  • Anomaly detection
    • Probability Density estimation, ex. 3Ïƒ for gaussian distribution features
  • Recommender System
    • Collaborative filtering
    • Deep-learning for content based filtering
    • Recommending from a large catalogue
      • Retrival & Ranking
  • Reinforcement Learning
    • state machine + positive/negative return, ex. good dog/bad dog
    • Markov Decision Process(MDP)
    • State-action value function
      • Belllman Equation

Machine Learning in Production

Lifecycle of ML

  1. Scope Project
  2. Collect Data
    • Define data and establish baseline
    • Label and organize data
  3. Train Model
    • Select and train model
    • Perform error analysis
  4. Deploy in production
    • Deploy in production
    • Monitor & maintain system
- https://yuhaolu.github.io/posts/cs/ml_stanford/ -
